TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BulletedListEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event is raised when a link button in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is clicked.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to specify and code an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control. When a list item is clicked, a message is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> on the page.

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the list item in a that raised the event.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs> class.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedListEventArgs.Index%2A>|The value of the `index` parameter.|

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the list item in a control that raised the event.
Docs.value: The index of the list item in a control that raised the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to programmatically access the index of the list item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control that raised the event.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to specify and code an event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.Click> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control. When a list item is clicked, a message is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control on the page.
